entry.title: Sublime Text as a Default Editor for Git and Others
entry.content:
If you want to set sublime as the main editor for git and other programs on your mac, depends on what you bash you use you should edit ~/.bash_profile or ~/.bashrc or ~/.zshrc and put these lines on it:

export VISUAL='subl -w'
export EDITOR="$VISUAL"
export GIT_EDITOR="$VISUAL"

Then open a new terminal and run this command : ln -s "/Applications/Sublime Text 2.app/Contents/SharedSupport/bin/subl" ~/bin/subl Now sublime can be run as a console program and when you hit git commit command sublime shows up in a new Tab. Refer to Sublime documentation.
